author: tersec
content: is it valid to use V1 fcU and retrieve a block with V2 getPayload with no withdrawals? https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/shanghai.md#engine_getpayloadv2 and https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/paris.md#specification-1 aren't clear on this that I can tell

author: ralexstokes
content: fcu hasn't changed, and at the appropriate time you'd want to start using getPayloadV2

author: tersec
content: fcU has changed though? there's the paris and shanghai versions. but the only change is the addition of `withdrawals`. this the question.

author: ralexstokes
content: yes, sorry it must change, i confused myself earlier

author: ralexstokes
content: the strictest thing is to only allow `getPayloadV2` for `forkchoiceUpdatedV2` and i'd say this is the intention behind the spec as written now

author: ralexstokes
content: that being said, clients could interpret `PayloadAttributesV1` as a `PayloadAttributesV2` with an empty `[]` withdrawals array

author: ralexstokes
content: i think we should make the spec explicit that calling fcuV1 and using that `payloadID` on `getPayloadV2` is an error

author: ralexstokes
content: otherwise we just need to handle some ambiguous case(s) or do something like version the `payloadID` itself

author: ralexstokes
content: do you (or anyone reading this)  have a preference?

author: ralexstokes
content: i can put together a PR soon

author: tersec
content: I'd prefer requiring an exact match. if there proves some good reason later, can loosen it

author: tersec
content: and prefer not versioning the payload ID

author: ralexstokes
content: yeah agree, i'll try to put up a PR tomorrow
